page.title: 06SALMON NETTING, BONAR
page.content: {Salmon Netting}in the{Kyle}was started about a 100 years ago . There are local men working at the netting. The fishers start their netting at the ebb tide. They have eight boats called{cobbles.}They use the boats to put the nets out on. The nets are pulled in using a winch. The biggest salmon they have caught weighed{forty {two and a half pounds.}The largest catch they have had was{41 fish.}Once they caught a seal in the net. They usually catch between{5000}and{6000 fish a year. The salmon are sent to the markets in London. If they have holes in the nets they mend them with a needle and twine. The netting season begins in May and ends in October.
